intro: Viburnum lantanoides praecox, commonly known as the early bloom­ing viburnum, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible for birds but not for humans. It typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet and prefers partial to full sunlight. Viburnum lantanoides praecox is valued for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
